definition:
Let $\Omega$ be a set, and ${\mathcal{P}(\Omega)}$ be the power set of
$\Omega$. A *$\pi$-system* (or pi-system) on $\Omega$ is a set
$\mathcal{F} \subseteq {\mathcal{P}(\Omega)}$ such that

$$A,B \in \mathcal{F} \Rightarrow A \cap B \in \mathcal{F}.$$

A $\pi$-system is closed under finite intersection.
